SEARCH
Package de.fherfurt.lat.api.resources

Klasse AddressResource

java.lang.Object
de.fherfurt.lat.api.resources.AddressResource
public class AddressResource extends Object
RESTful resource class for managing addresses.

This resource provides endpoints to retrieve, create, and manage address entities. It interacts with the IAddressService to perform CRUD operations on addresses, and uses the Mapper to convert between entities and data transfer objects (DTOs).

The following HTTP methods are supported:

  • GET - Retrieve all addresses or a specific address by ID
  • POST - Create a new address
Siehe auch:
  • IAddressService
  • Mapper
  • AddressService
  • AddressDto

  • Konstruktordetails

    • AddressResource

      public AddressResource()
      Constructs a new AddressResource and initializes the address service.

      The AddressService is used as the implementation of IAddressService.

  • Methodendetails

    • getAddresses

      @GET @Produces("application/json") public List<AddressDto> getAddresses()
      Retrieves a list of all addresses.

      This method maps the Address entities to AddressDto objects and returns them as a JSON list.

      Gibt zurück:
      a list of AddressDto objects representing all addresses.

    • getAddress

      @GET @Path("{addressId:\\d+}") @Produces("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAddress(@PathParam("addressId") int addressId)
      Retrieves a specific address by its ID.

      If the address with the specified ID is found, it is returned as a JSON response. If not found, a 404 (Not Found) status is returned.

      Parameter:
      addressId - the ID of the address to retrieve.
      Gibt zurück:
      a Response containing the AddressDto if found, or a 404 status if not found.

    • createAddress

      @POST @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createAddress(AddressDto addressDto, @Context javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers)
      Creates a new address.

      This method accepts an AddressDto in the request body, converts it to an Address entity, and attempts to save it using the address service. If the address is successfully created, a 201 (Created) status is returned. If the creation fails, a 304 (Not Modified) status is returned.

      Parameter:
      addressDto - the AddressDto representing the address to be created.
      headers - the HTTP headers of the request (optional, used for additional context if needed).
      Gibt zurück:
      a Response indicating the outcome of the create operation.
